comments:
From the newsgroup:

We create a swt browser and launch it in our perspectives view and I see the
following problem. ( Note everything works fine under Windows XP SWT. )

Heres the info in the console window I see

>>Unhandled event loop exception
>>Reason:
>>No more handles [NS_InitEmbedding
/usr/lib/mozilla-1.4:/usr/lib/mozilla-1.4
>>erro r -2147221164]

in the .log file in the workspace I see:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 Aug 13, 2004 10:54:53.945
!MESSAGE No more handles [NS_InitEmbedding
/usr/lib/mozilla-1.4:/usr/lib/mozilla-1.4 error -2147221164]
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: No more handles [NS_InitEmbedding
/usr/lib/mozilla-1.4:/usr/lib/mozilla-1.4 error -2147221164]
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2717)
	at org.eclipse.swt.browser.Browser.<init>(Browser.java:158)
at
com.xxxx.internal.BrowserEditor.createBrowser(BrowserEditor.java:152)
	at
com.xxxx.internal.BrowserEditor.createPartControl(BrowserEditor.java:62)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.PartPane$2.run(PartPane.java:137)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.run(InternalPlatform.java
:615)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.run(Platform.java:747)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.PartPane.createChildControl
(PartPane.java:133)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.PartPane.createControl(PartPane.java:205)
	at
org.eclipse.ui.internal.PartStack.refreshPresentationSelection(PartStack.jav
a:939)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.PartStack.setSelection(PartStack.java:921)
	at
org.eclipse.ui.internal.EditorStack.setVisibleEditor(EditorStack.java:170)
	at........


the browser is created like the following (from the stack above
BrowserEditor.java:152)

final Browser browser = new Browser(parent, SWT.NONE);

where parent is a Composite.

everything works fine under windows. But when we try to open the browser
under linux we immediately get the No More Handles Error from SWT error
dialog.

any ideas?

Mike: for some reason the MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME environment is set 
to /usr/lib/mozilla-1.4:/usr/lib/mozilla-1.4
instead of simply
/usr/lib/mozilla-1.4

A few questions to understand why this is happening.

Can you paste the content of the file /etc/gre.conf ?
Can you try the following
1. Open a terminal
2. setenv MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME /usr/lib/mozilla-1.4     (cshell users)
3. eclipse    (start eclipse)
Do you have a different message?

My conf file looks correct per whats mentioned in the FAQs, environment
variables are set up, in my shell script file, so I think thats why its in there
twice.

note I have tried setting the MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME variable. our application won't
start with out it set. Note I'm taking this off line and directly to Chris for now
Marking as INVALID. Following up through email directly.
